title: Wintel Engineer SME
description:
**Role Description**
 We are seeking a highly experienced
 **Senior Wintel Engineer** 
 with 12‚Äì15 years of expertise in
 **VMware, Wintel, Azure IaaS, Active Directory, and automation** 
 (Ansible, PowerShell, Python, Bash). The ideal candidate will design, implement, and optimize enterprise\\-level Windows and virtualization infrastructure across hybrid cloud environments. Basic knowledge of
 **Pure Storage** 
 is preferred.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect, deploy, and manage Wintel\\-based infrastructure across on\\-premises and Azure cloud environments.
* Design, configure, and maintain VMware vSphere, ESXi, vCenter, and virtualized workloads.
* Manage Azure IaaS including VM provisioning, networking, backup, and monitoring.
* Administer and optimize Active Directory (AD), Group Policies, Entra ID, and authentication mechanisms.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and system administration using Ansible, PowerShell, Python, and Bash scripting.
* Troubleshoot complex Windows Server, VMware, and cloud infrastructure issues ensuring high availability and performance.
* Implement server hardening, patching, and security policies to maintain compliance.
* Perform storage provisioning and integration with Pure Storage (basic knowledge required).
* Collaborate with networking, security, and DevOps teams for seamless infrastructure integration.
* Mentor and guide junior engineers, promoting best practices in infrastructure management.


**Qualifications \\& Experience**
* 16‚Äì20 years of experience in Wintel engineering, VMware, and cloud infrastructure.
* Extensive experience in Windows Server administration (2016/2019/2022\\), Active Directory, and GPO management.
* Strong expertise in VMware (vSphere, ESXi, vCenter) and virtualization technologies.
* Hands\\-on experience with Azure IaaS, cloud automation, and migration strategies.
* Proficiency in Ansible, PowerShell, Python, and Bash scripting for automation and configuration management.
* Basic understanding of Pure Storage and storage provisioning.
* Strong knowledge of security best practices, system hardening, and compliance standards.
* Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills, with experience in stakeholder management.
* Preferred certifications: VMware VCP, Microsoft Azure Administrator/Architect, or equivalent.


**Preferred Skills**
* Experience working in hybrid cloud environments integrating on\\-premises and Azure solutions.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles.
* Understanding of enterprise networking concepts (DNS, DHCP, VPN, Load Balancers).
* Knowledge of the ITIL framework for incident, problem, and change management.


**Skills**
 Windows,Vmware Virtualization,Ansible

description:

* Extensive knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and have worked using Water\\-Fall and Agile methodologies.
* Expertise in Microsoft .NET MVC latest versions /technologies such as Visual Studio .NET, C\\#, ASP .NET, Web Forms, AJAX, ADO.NET, VB.Net, WCF, Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS and SSAS.
* In depth knowledge on Database Designing, Application Development, Strong Technical exposure and Practical knowledge on .NET MVC, OOPS, C\\#, SQL Server and JQuery
* Should be an individual contributor as well as team player and aware of the entire SDLC ( Software Development Life Cycle ), should have developed application from Scratch )
* Analyse software requirements and implement software code
* Actively participate in all aspects of new product development and enhancements to existing applications


**About Us**
 At eClerx, we serve some of the largest global companies ‚Äì 50 of the Fortune 500 clients. Our clients call upon us to solve their most complex problems, and deliver transformative insights. Across roles and levels, you get the opportunity to build expertise, challenge the status quo, think bolder, and help our clients seize value
   

  

**About The Team**
 eClerx is a global leader in productized services, bringing together people, technology and domain expertise to amplify business results. Our mission is to set the benchmark for client service and success in our industry. Since our inception in 2000, we've partnered with top companies across various industries, including financial services, telecommunications, retail, and high\\-tech. Our innovative solutions and domain expertise help businesses optimize operations, improve efficiency, and drive growth. With over 18,000 employees worldwide, eClerx is dedicated to delivering excellence through smart automation and data\\-driven insights. At eClerx, we believe in nurturing talent and providing hands\\-on experience.

title: Staff/Senior Engineer, CAD
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for
 *all* 
 .**
 Micron Technology is a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever.
   

  

**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life.**
 Join an inclusive team united by a single purpose: leveraging expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for our customers and partners. The solutions we create enable everything from immersive virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks. We achieve this while upholding integrity, promoting sustainability, and giving back to our communities, because these values fuel the very innovation we strive for.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **CAD Staff/Senior Engineer** 
 at
 **Micron Technology, Inc.** 
 , you will be part of a collaborative team dedicated to developing comprehensive software solutions that address the challenges faced by memory design teams.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Tasks Include, But Not Limited To**
* Work closely with semiconductor design teams and solve their day\\-to\\-day challenges as well as provide complete software solutions for future.
* Focus on Memory Design and CAD infrastructure setup, specifically: Methodics, Perforce, Jenkins, Virtuoso, Design project setup and Design environment management.
* Proactively identify problem areas for improvement, propose, and develop innovative solutions.
* Develop highly scalable, and clean software systems.
* Continuously evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to improve the current software flows.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior members of the team.


**Qualifications**
* Must have semiconductor or Electronic Design Automation experience.
* Solid object\\-oriented programming skills along with experience in test\\-driven software development. Python and Pytest is preferred.
* Good understanding of version control tools such as Perforce and Bitbucket.
* Working knowledge of Linux is highly preferred.
* Experience with load balancing platforms like LSF.
* Exposure to Jenkins and containerization technologies such as Docker.
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills with attention to details.
* Ability to work in a dynamic environment.
* Proficiency in working effectively with global teams and stakeholders.


**Education And Experience**
* A bachelor‚Äôs or a master‚Äôs degree in computer engineering, or electronics engineering.
* Minimum 5 years of working experience.


**About Micron Technology, Inc.**
 We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life
 *for all* 
 . With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high\\-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron¬Æ and Crucial¬Æ brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities ‚Äî from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.

description:

 : Remote
   

  

**Placement Type** 
 : Full Time Permanent position(Payroll and Compliance to be managed by: A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

**(\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' client \\- A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

**What do you need for this opportunity?
   

  

**Must have skills required:**
 BI style data models, Snowflake or SQL warehouses, Agentic AI, CrewAI or ADK, LangChain, LangGraph, MongoDB and SQL, NLQ, AWS, Python
   

  

**A Series A funded California based Software Development Company is Looking for:**
**AI Engineer**
**NLQ Systems, Agentic Workflows, Analytical Insights******
**Experience**
 4 to 8 years total engineering experience with Python.
   

  

 2 to 4 years minimum proven production experience with AI agentic systems (LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, ADK or similar).
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We need an AI engineer to build the NLQ layer across our MongoDB data and SQL based KPI datasets, and create agent workflows that generate analytical insights and dashboards. You should have hands\\-on experience designing and shipping agent systems in production and be comfortable working across data, AI, and backend pipelines on AWS.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build NLQ modules to query MongoDB and SQL KPI data
* Design agentic workflows for data retrieval, merging, and insight generation
* Produce structured outputs for analytical dashboards and reporting
* Deploy and optimise AI systems in AWS with proper monitoring
* Collaborate with backend and product teams to translate requirements into workflow logic


**Required Skills**
* Production experience with agentic frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI or ADK
* Strong Python or Node background for AI pipelines
* Solid understanding of MongoDB and SQL data systems
* Experience with retrieval pipelines, embeddings, and vector stores
* AWS deployment knowledge including monitoring and reliability practices
* Good understanding of KPI or analytics style data and output formats


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with dashboarding systems or BI style data models
* Familiarity with Snowflake or SQL warehouses
* Prior work building NLQ chat layers or semantic search systems

**Must have skills required:**
 AWS certifications., EKS, or Secrets Manager., Step functions, Ansible, Cloudfront, ECS, IAM, Lambda, Python Scripting, Terraform, AWS
   

  

**A Series A funded California based Software Development Company is Looking for:******
**Role Overview**
 We are hiring an AWS DevOps Engineer with strong hands\\-on experience in cloud infrastructure, Terraform automation, container deployments, security best practices, and Python scripting. You will help maintain and scale our AWS environments, support deployments, and strengthen our security posture.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build and manage AWS resources using Terraform modules for consistent infra provisioning.
* Deploy and operate services on ECS (Fargate), Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFront, and related components.
* Implement monitoring and alerting using CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, or Datadog.
* Improve security by enforcing IAM best practices, Config rules, SecurityHub checks, WAF policies, and SOC2 controls.
* Develop Python scripts to automate infra tasks, workflows, and operational tools.
* Support CI/CD pipelines and work closely with developers for smooth deployments.
* Troubleshoot production issues across containers, networking, and serverless systems.


**Requirements**
* 2 to 4\\+ years of DevOps experience with strong AWS fundamentals.
* Solid experience with Terraform, Ansible, ECS, Lambda, CloudFront, IAM, VPC, and networking basics.
* Good understanding of cloud security and SOC2 readiness practices.
* Strong Python scripting skills for automation.
* Experience with CI/CD tooling (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or similar).
* Familiarity with observability tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, or Datadog.


**Nice to Have**
**Experience With EKS, Step Functions, Or Secrets Manager.**
 AWS certifications.

title: AWS Devops Engineer
description:
**Experience** 
 : 2\\.00 \\+ years
   

  

**Salary** 
 : INR 1500000\\-2500000 / year (based on experience)
   

  

**Expected Notice Period** 
 : 7 Days
   

  

**Shift** 
 : (GMT\\+05:30\\) Asia/Kolkata (IST)
   

  

**Opportunity Type** 
 : Remote
   

  

**Placement Type** 
 : Full Time Permanent position(Payroll and Compliance to be managed by: A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

**(\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' client \\- A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

**What do you need for this opportunity?
   

  

**Must have skills required:**
 AWS certifications., EKS, or Secrets Manager., Step functions, Ansible, Cloudfront, ECS, IAM, Lambda, Python Scripting, Terraform, AWS
   

  

**A Series A funded California based Software Development Company is Looking for:******
**Role Overview**
 We are hiring an AWS DevOps Engineer with strong hands\\-on experience in cloud infrastructure, Terraform automation, container deployments, security best practices, and Python scripting. You will help maintain and scale our AWS environments, support deployments, and strengthen our security posture.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build and manage AWS resources using Terraform modules for consistent infra provisioning.
* Deploy and operate services on ECS (Fargate), Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFront, and related components.
* Implement monitoring and alerting using CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, or Datadog.
* Improve security by enforcing IAM best practices, Config rules, SecurityHub checks, WAF policies, and SOC2 controls.
* Develop Python scripts to automate infra tasks, workflows, and operational tools.
* Support CI/CD pipelines and work closely with developers for smooth deployments.
* Troubleshoot production issues across containers, networking, and serverless systems.


**Requirements**
* 2 to 4\\+ years of DevOps experience with strong AWS fundamentals.
* Solid experience with Terraform, Ansible, ECS, Lambda, CloudFront, IAM, VPC, and networking basics.
* Good understanding of cloud security and SOC2 readiness practices.
* Strong Python scripting skills for automation.
* Experience with CI/CD tooling (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or similar).
* Familiarity with observability tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, or Datadog.


**Nice to Have**
**Experience With EKS, Step Functions, Or Secrets Manager.**
 AWS certifications.

 Shift time\\- 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM

**AI Engineer**
**NLQ Systems, Agentic Workflows, Analytical Insights******
**Experience**
 4 to 8 years total engineering experience with Python.
   

  

 2 to 4 years minimum proven production experience with AI agentic systems (LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, ADK or similar).
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We need an AI engineer to build the NLQ layer across our MongoDB data and SQL based KPI datasets, and create agent workflows that generate analytical insights and dashboards. You should have hands\\-on experience designing and shipping agent systems in production and be comfortable working across data, AI, and backend pipelines on AWS.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build NLQ modules to query MongoDB and SQL KPI data
* Design agentic workflows for data retrieval, merging, and insight generation
* Produce structured outputs for analytical dashboards and reporting
* Deploy and optimise AI systems in AWS with proper monitoring
* Collaborate with backend and product teams to translate requirements into workflow logic


**Required Skills**
* Production experience with agentic frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI or ADK
* Strong Python or Node background for AI pipelines
* Solid understanding of MongoDB and SQL data systems
* Experience with retrieval pipelines, embeddings, and vector stores
* AWS deployment knowledge including monitoring and reliability practices
* Good understanding of KPI or analytics style data and output formats


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with dashboarding systems or BI style data models
* Familiarity with Snowflake or SQL warehouses
* Prior work building NLQ chat layers or semantic search systems
